other_tests.changes_over_time: The parvovirus B19 load rebounded to its original level when salvage therapy was started in June 1998. The suppression of HIV-1 replication achieved by salvage therapy resulted in gradual control of parvovirus B19 infection.

other_tests.findings: Immunoglobulin G and immunoglobulin M antibodies against B19 were not detected when anemia initially resolved but were detected after salvage therapy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initially, no antibodies were detected after the initial remission, but strong IgM and IgG antibodies against parvovirus B19 were detectable after the patient commenced salvage therapy.

other_tests.findings: Weak reactivity to VP-C and VP-N was seen, strong reactivity against NS-1 and VP2 was detected.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Reactivity to VP1 linear epitopes remained weak throughout the follow-up period of 10 months.
